data.title: Just a two-bite burger
data.text:
So I just added pics of my order and my description.  (Not really palatable)
But... One good side, the staff who took my order was nice and friendly.

data.title: Run for hills
data.text: Had to pull off the interstate to avoid snow storm. Bogies located at the clarion was our only option. I just don't know where to begin. The entire experience was horrible! Services was more than slow. Food was absolutely TERRIBLE! If you want to go there to drink only you will be fine. Don't waste your money ! Food came out wrong twice!

data.title: mismanaged
data.text: terribly mismanaged, they were running out of stock for drinks, breakfast food, lids for to-go cups etc. Although they were coming under new management when I left maybe it will improve.

data.title: poor selection
data.text: Service was great, but the menu is very small, and the food is just 'ok'.  Pizza, burger, club sandwich, cheese dip and a few other items, that's it

data.title: A bit to be desired but suffice.
data.text: Stayed @hotel & this was the obvious choice. Menu was limited & they ran out of hamburger meat. We were tired & hungry so we settled.

data.title: Hidden Treasure
data.text: The food here was amazing, especially the pizza!  A great little treat is the price, incredibly low...

data.title: The Food was Excellent !!!
data.text: Be sure to order the Rib Eye Steak !! The wait staff and the Room Service was above and beyond what anyone would expect. Our food was better that a 5 Star Rest. You will truly be amazed !!!

data.title: Okay -- that's it.
data.text:
We went here for dinner because it adjoins the hotel where we were staying, and after a long day of driving we were too tired to go find a chain restaurant.

The food was not so good, not much more to say.  Neither my wife nor I were impressed by our dinners.  A grilled chicken salad should be more than a pound of green leaf lettuce and cut-up chicken.  And the price seemed a bit high for what we got.  Service was okay.  This was not a crowded place, so there was one guy on duty as bartender/server/bus boy.  He seemed nice enough.

I wasn't impressed, but on some basic level it meets peoples' needs for a restaurant.  Just keep your expectations in line with where you are.

data.title: breakfast
data.text: we had the buffet before we took off for the road and I found it very good and filling. The area was clean and the coffe was hot !!

data.title: Review of Restaurant only
data.text: We have not stayed at the motel, but we used to eat regularly at the restaurant.  We  started eating at Bogie's about a year ago on a http://restaurant.com certificate.  It quickly became our favorite place to eat.  We would drive from Heber Springs (over 1 hr) just to eat at Bogie's.  Unfortunately, our last trip was such a disappointment that we will not return.  The food took 45 min to arrive.  Their signature sandwich (the Monte Cristo) was a wonderful deep fried delight that this time was cooked in grease that was not hot enough, so it was a greasy inedible mess.  The french fries were undercooked and obviously cooked in grease that fish had been cooked in.  We would have sent our food back but we had already waited so long that we did not wish to stay any longer.  I was able to go to the bar and get the waitress to stop flirting with the bar patrons long enough to give me my ticket.  Time to find a new favorite place to eat!
